questiontext.text:
A sample of 235 students in the Faculty of Social Sciences at Utrecht University are given a questionnaire to complete about feelings. One of the questions read, “What do you think about your own height?” The response categories were: too short, about right, too tall. A total score was calculated for all students; it measures students’ self-esteem. The results of the self-esteem scores are compared between the three height-sensitive groups and between boys and girls. The F-ratio for the interaction effect between height-feelings and gender is \(4.98\) with a \(p\)-value of \(.008\).

How is the \(p\)-value of \(.008\) calculated?

answer.text: The area to the right of \(F = 4.98\) Under the F-distribution.
The area to the left of \(F = 4.98\) Under the F-distribution.
The area to the left of \(F = −4.98\) en rechts van \(F = 4.98\) Under the F-distribution.
The area between \(F = -4.98\) and \(F = 4.98\) under the F distribution.
